newsitem.title: LATVIA: EFTA SATISFIED WITH LATVIA - NEWSPAPER.
newsitem.headline: EFTA SATISFIED WITH LATVIA - NEWSPAPER.

text.p: A European Free Trade Association (EFTA) delegation said it was satisfied with Latvia's economic performance after an agreement was signed with the Baltic state last June, Diena newspaper said on Thursday.
"Mutual trade and investment relations are quite dynamic but rather small in volume terms," Rudolf Rasmussen, head of the EFTA delegation, was quoted by the newspaper as saying.
The delegation visited Latvia to evaluate the effectiveness of the agreement and necessary changes as well new legislation during the past year, the newspaper said.
"The agreement with Latvia should be extended to include services in the nearest future," Rasmussen added.

Goods worth as much as one billion dollars were traded between Latvia and EFTA nations in 1996 with timber, paper and minerals being the exports. Latvia imports mainly machinery, meat products and textiles.
